title: Was there a separate offering for unintended sins (Ezekiel, sin, offering, hermeneutics)? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Torah designates that a sin-offering may ONLY be brought for an unintentional sin (Leviticus 4:27–39). A person who sinned intentionally atoned by repentance and, in the case of a sin in which the sinner caused financial loss to another person, making restitution.
